intro: Edraianthus sutjeskae subsp. maslesae, commonly known as the Sutjeska bellflower, is a rare and endemic species native to the Balkan region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in mountainous areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is part of the Campanulaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
